See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see . # Spike Response Plasticity Implementation of a linear-nonlinear model of short-term plasticity as described in [Linear-Nonlinear Cascades Capture Synaptic Dynamics](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2021/01/27/2020.06.04.133892). ## Repository Structure - The **srplasticity** package contains all source code and implements the SRP model and the associated parameter inference. - The **examples** directory contains use examples and tutorials (currently in progress) - The **scripts** directory contains the scripts to reproduce the figures in the manuscript - The **data** directory contains the data used in the manuscript figures and the use examples. ## Preprint Citation 
@article {Rossbroich2020.06.04.133892,
	author = {Rossbroich, Julian and Trotter, Daniel and Beninger, John and T{\'o}th, Katalin and Naud, Richard},
	title = {Linear-Nonlinear Cascades Capture Synaptic Dynamics},
	year = {2021},
	publisher = {Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory},
	URL = {https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2021/01/27/2020.06.04.133892},
	eprint = {https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2021/01/27/2020.06.04.133892.full.pdf},
	journal = {bioRxiv}
}
info.name: srplasticity
